data.why:
Initially a module that encodes UTF8 binary characters as their
    textual numeric identities. For example, it might convert the Euro
    symbol to the string "â‚¬". Also, because it is used with XML it
    converts quotes and angled brackets to their entity names (such as
    "<"). The reason for the module is speed. The normal regex
    conversion are slow but this module is written in C and therefore
    much faster.
